subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Quickscript practice site
msgSnippet: Jerry: I guess I ve been too busy - the bane of the modern world - not to mention keeping food on the table.  I just now ran across your e-mail about your
messageBody:
Jerry:

 

I guess I’ve been too busy – the bane of the modern world – not to mention keeping food on the table.  I just now ran across your e-mail about your single letter practice site, which is linked to the Read_Alphabet site.  I really like it.  How much trouble would it be to expand on that idea and add a series of basic words for a beginner to read?  Might it be practicable if the work could be shared in some manner by some of our group members?  It seems to me this would be quite useful for introducing a beginner to the idea of phonemic spelling, which thinks to the deficiencies of T.O. is, apparently, a totally alien concept to many.  I like the fact that it gives the individual immediate feedback.

 

Paige Gabhart

 

"I despise a world which does not feel that music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy."
-Ludwig van Beethoven

-----Original Message-----
From: Jerry [mailto:nieuwsgroep222@...]
Sent: Saturday, May 22, 2004 5:03 PM
To: read_alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Quickscript practice site

 

Hi all!

The last few days I've been making a practice site for quickscript. It
randomly chooses quickscript signs which the visitor can name. It features
automatic dutch/English language selection.

The address is:

http://www.xs4all.nl/~ransau/quickscript/letters_oefenen/

Please let me know what you think.

Regards,
Jerry
